title: Medusa Wallet
description: ウェブベースのウォレットには、潜在的に安全でない鍵処理シナリオを使用しているものがたくさんあります。Medusaはそれを修正する必要があります。

f6_assessments.q0: medusa wallet strongly complies with the impact/alignment of the fund and would provide a strong addition to the badly needed lite wallet list.
f6_assessments.q1: proposer has years of experience working within the Cardano ecosystem, having been part of the ITN. there is every reason to believe that the proposer has the necessary skills and experience to bring this project to completion.
f6_assessments.q2: proposer already has a working wallet and only seeks finding to add features and functions to the existing software. this provides the community with an extremely good view of milestones and provides exceptional auditability.

f6_assessments.q0: While there are many wallets competing for top spot right now in the Cardano ecosystem, I think another one that sets itself apart from the others is the right addition. The proposer clearly articulates why their wallet is more secure than competitors and provides a test version for users to try out. As a Cardano holder, I know how important security over your tokens is, and it's just as important to have a simple UX that is easy to use and gives you confidence you are doing it right. It seems like Medusa wallet can solve those and if so, it would have a huge impact for the community.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers already have a working product with 1000+ users. This ups the feasibility factor for me. The fact that they provide a link for users to try out gives additional confidence that it is feasible. The budget also seems reasonable with a modest salary for the developer making up the majority. My only critique is that I would have liked to see a launch date in this proposal to allow voters to know when to expect it.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposers could have done a better job at providing auditability measures for voters. Yes, the product is completed. A launch date would be better. The proposal does clearly lay out the problem and how they plan to solve it but an additional roadmap on when the new features would be rolled out should be included. How long is it expected to take? In my opinion, voters should have this information before voting. These further details would give perfect marks.

f6_assessments.q0: there is a clear need for a product like this one, which balances ease of use and security
f6_assessments.q1: a working version of the wallet already exists on the Cardano testnet
f6_assessments.q2: project aims to take input from users and implements them, so there is an element of auditability there.

f6_assessments.q0: Wallets like this with high security and improved usability are critical to safety in the Cardano ecosystem. This project promises to remedy some glaring issues with existing wallets. However, it does not address the emerging need for integration with DApps, which would strengthen the proposal's alignment with this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal demonstrates understanding of the security threat surface for web applications. The MVP is evidence of the development team's competence.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provides a specific list of features and implies the approximate timeframe for implementing them. Is specifically includes a security audit that would verify that requirements are met.

f6_assessments.q0: Web-based wallets provide more flexibility than full node wallets in any respect. A high-security web-based wallet with features stated in the proposal will provide the ADA holder with more options. This project can also be referenced as a benchmark after audit.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has experience in cardano ecosystem as developer and has produced a working wallet in testnet thereforethey will be able to complete the project.
f6_assessments.q2: The cost breakdown is reasonable and the time frame is achievable. The team also has a working product. There is a need for a third party security audit of 3000$ for the same looks small. But the aim and the plan looks clearly auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea is sound as currently there's no widely adopted web based wallet for Cardano. This will allow more adoption for people that prefers to access the wallet via web browser.
f6_assessments.q1: There seems to be already v 1.0 of the application. The team definitely has capability to execute, however the current version is no longer active. The concern I have is how much commitment will the team spend based on how the first version went.
f6_assessments.q2: The author claimed that this new version will be more secured, and promised of a third party security audit. It would be great if the auditor is identified as it's just as important to have a well known auditor to foresee this project especially when cyber security/hack is a major problem these days, not to mention browser access is more prone to hack than via mobile phone.

f6_assessments.q0: The wallet space and additional functionality and choices is a hot topic in the cardano ecosystem and this project seeks to help in that space.  Although this is an area where additional solutions and features are needed badly in Cardano, it does seem that this is starting to get a crowded area between wallet development projects.  This will have an effect on everyone since it would be available to everyone who is a Cardano holder.
f6_assessments.q1: This project is a reprisal of an artifiact wallet that was built in the ITN days and is looking to jumpstart it with additional capabilities that are available now in the Goguen era of Cardano.  This project has a firm background and team behind it to support it, although the hiatus of the project in the first place does cast some doubt into the proposers commitment.
f6_assessments.q2: This project has very strong metrics and KPIs tied to it to help support and built the features and wallet of the project and should be fairly transparent and auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: There are many wallets already out there (Yoroi, Daeadalus, CC Wallet, AdaLite etc) so adding one doesn't increase the impact of Cardano much. Although there's already a somewhat functioning prototype, this seems to have some bugs (based on the communique in Twitter) and it's still running on Testnet only. According to the proposer, the old version at https://adawallet.io is no longer under active development, with the main focus now being on a new re-designed version, based on cardano-db-sync and Emurgo's serialization lib. The challenge states "What applications will provide the most value for end users in 2021?" and since this is asking for funding for a year, the results might materialize some time in 2022. Essentially the proposer is asking for funding to develop a new version for the 1,000+ users that constitute "the community", making this a bit of a fringe proposal. It's hard to see this hitting mainstream any time soon.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer states that "Medusa has a little team with main developer, artist and testers" and that "It's not a primary occupation" for them. Yet the budget only includes funding for the developer, which I assume means the proposer himself. The proposer has applied for funding earlier and didn't get the funding. Now the budget is the same but the plan is slightly different. While 2,000 USD a month is not much for a developer, the fact that the entire funding would go to one person, without any gurantees of results, sounds a bit risky.
f6_assessments.q2:
While the proposer is self-proclaiming to be building a superior technology when it comes to security and anonymity, this is only his personal opinion and cannot be vetted without digging into the code. The proposal includes $3k for a security audit but it's unclear which instance would carry out the audit with such little budget.

Milestones, deliverables and KPIs are not mentioned. The launch date is not set because "it's already a working product".

Please note that I don't have technical expertise to evaluate the code or assess the technical merits of the proposal.
